act_info.full_title: Supplementary Interim Appropriation for 2021-2022 Act, 2021, S.O. 2021, c. 40, Sched. 20

content.content: 1 Expressions used in this Act have the same meaning as in the Financial Administration Act unless the context requires otherwise.
content.raw_html: 1 Expressions used in this Act have the same meaning as in the Financial Administration Act unless the context requires otherwise.

content.section: Additional amounts to be paid or recognized
content.content: 2 All amounts authorized under sections 3 and 4 to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments are in addition to the amounts authorized to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments under sections 2 and 3 of the Interim Appropriation for 2021-2022 Act, 2020.
content.raw_html: 2 All amounts authorized under sections 3 and 4 to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments are in addition to the amounts authorized to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments under sections 2 and 3 of the Interim Appropriation for 2021-2022 Act, 2020.

content.content: 3 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2022, amounts not exceeding a total of $6,737,788,900 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses to be applied to the expenses of the public service that are not otherwise provided for.
content.raw_html: 3 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2022, amounts not exceeding a total of $6,737,788,900 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses to be applied to the expenses of the public service that are not otherwise provided for.

content.content: 4 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2022, amounts not exceeding a total of $155,544,400 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash investments to be applied to the investments of the public service in capital assets, loans and other investments that are not otherwise provided for.
content.raw_html: 4 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2022, amounts not exceeding a total of $155,544,400 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash investments to be applied to the investments of the public service in capital assets, loans and other investments that are not otherwise provided for.

content.content:
